text: Charles Coste (born 8 February 1924) is a French cyclist. He was born in Ollioules, France. He won a gold medal at the 1948 Summer Olympics in London. He finished in fourth place in the 1950 Paris–Roubaix. Coste turned 100 in February 2024. He lit the Olympic torch at the 2024 Summer Olympics in Paris. In January 2025, after the death of Ágnes Keleti, Coste became the oldest living Olympic champion. ==References== Category:1924 births Category:Living people Category:French centenarians Category:French cyclists Category:Olympic gold medalists for France Category:Sportspeople from Provence-Alpes-Cote d'Azur Category:People from Var
title: Charles Coste
